intro: Mesosphaerum collinum, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that help it retain water in dry conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Mesosphaerum collinum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in regions with limited rainfall.
